variant.question:
Which of these statements about an reaction turbine are correct or incorrect?

I. The pressure remains constant across the nozzle guide vanes.   
 II. The pressure rises across the rotor blades.

options.text: I is correct, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is correct, II is correct.

variant.question:
Which of these statements about a reaction turbine are correct or incorrect?

I. The pressure rises across the nozzle guide vanes.  
II. The pressure drops across the rotor blades.

options.text: I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is correct, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is correct, II is correct.

variant.question: The axial compressor of a gas turbine engine usually has more stages than its driving turbine because:

options.text: turbine speed is much higher than compressor speed.
the power output of a turbine stage is higher than the power consumption of a compressor stage.
the compressor consumes much more power than the turbine.
bleed air is taken from the compressor.

variant.question:
Which of these statements about an impulse turbine are correct or incorrect?

I. The pressure rises across the nozzle guide vanes.   
II. The pressure rises across the rotor blades.

options.text: I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is correct, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is correct, II is correct.

variant.question:
Which of the following statements is correct about the flow in a divergent (subsonic) gas turbine engine intake?

1\. The static pressure remains constant in flow direction.   
2\. The total temperature decreases in flow direction.

options.text: 1 is correct, 2 is incorrect.
Both 1 and 2 are correct.
1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.
Both 1 and 2 are incorrect.

variant.question: A diffuser in a gas turbine engine is a device in which the:

options.text: velocity, pressure and temperature rise.
pressure rises at a constant velocity.
pressure rises and velocity falls.
velocity rises and pressure falls.

variant.question: What are the main components of a turbine engine starting system?

options.text: A starter and an igniter to ignite the air/fuel mixture in the combustion system.
High-pressure fuel pumps and a compressor to raise the pressure of the air/fuel mixture for starting.
A turbine to compress and ignite the air/fuel mixture in the combustion chamber.
A combustion chamber, a starter, and bleed air to ignite the air/fuel mixture.

variant.question: One of the advantages of an annular combustion chamber in a gas turbine engine is:

options.text: that fewer igniters are required.
a reduced thermal stress on the turbine.
a higher structural strength.
a simpler assembly.

variant.question: In a theoretical gas turbine cycle, combustion takes place at constant:

options.text: volume
temperature
energy
pressure

variant.question: Fuel for gas turbine engines is usually heated in order to:

options.text: improve atomisation at low temperature.
prevent icing-up of the LP filter.
improve the specific fuel consumption.
improve thermal efficiency.

variant.question: Some components of a turbine engine are required to operate at their maximum temperature. What are the components which are exposed to the greatest thermal loads?

options.text: Turbine nozzle guide vanes and the first stage of the LP turbine.
Duplex burner and flame tube.
First stage turbine nozzle guide vanes and the first stage of the HP turbine.
HP turbine and jet pipe.

variant.question: The primary reason for a limitation being imposed on the temperature of the gas flow in a gas turbine engine is to:

options.text: prevent damage to the jet pipe from overheating.
ensure that the maximum acceptable gas temperature within the combustion chamber is not exceeded.
prevent overheating and subsequent creep due to centrifugal forces of the nozzle guide vanes.
ensure that the maximum acceptable temperature of the turbine nozzle guide vanes is not exceeded.

variant.question: In a gas turbine engine the air flow passages between adjacent axial compressor rotor blades are divergent, but the absolute exit velocity is higher than the absolute entry velocity of the rotor. This is because:

options.text: the gas expands between the blades.
the compressor rotational velocity slows down the air flow.
part of the compressor work delivered to the air is converted into kinetic energy.
it is a constant temperature process.

 2\. during engine acceleration

variant.question: Turbine blade stages may be classed as either "impulse" or "reaction". In an impulse turbine stage:

options.text: the pressure drops across the stator blades and remains constant across the rotor blades.
the pressure rises across the stator blades and remains constant across the rotor blades.
the pressure remains constant across stator blades and rises across the rotor blades.
the pressure remains constant across the stator blades and drops across the rotor blades.

variant.question: Consider a gas turbine engine. The diffuser of a centrifugal-flow compressor stage creates a

options.text: convergent area at the impeller exit to reduce the air velocity and increase the air pressure.
divergent area at the impeller exit to increase both the air velocity and the air pressure.
divergent area at the impeller exit to reduce the air velocity and increase the air pressure.
convergent area at the impeller inlet to increase both the air velocity and the air pressure.

variant.question:
Which missing words correctly complete the following statement:

The purpose of Active clearance control system in a gas turbine engine is to maintain a (1)\_\_\_ separation between the turbine and the outer casing, by providing cooling air to the turbine (2)\_\_\_.

options.text: (1) maximum; (2) blades.
(1) minimum; (2) blades.
(1) minimum; (2) outer case.
(1) maximum; (2) disc.

variant.question: A flat rated turbofan will be temperature limited if:

options.text: ambient pressure is lower than standard sea level ambient pressure.
ambient pressure is higher than standard sea level ambient pressure.
OAT is lower than flat rated temperature.
OAT is higher than flat rated temperature.

variant.question: When the combustion gases pass through a turbine stage the:

pressure drops.

variant.question: To ensure efficient combustion in a gas turbine engine

options.text: it must be capable of creating the optimal mixture of air and fuel.
air must be supplied to the combustor section at a constant flow.
